components.description:
Moon Viewing Ceremonies (called Tsukimi in Japan) are held each year in autumn to celebrate the full moon and waxing moon in Japan.

This symbol shows Japanese pampas grass and dango (sweet dessert food) which are used in the ceremony, as well as the moon in the background.
components.title: Moon Viewing Ceremony

description:
Moon Viewing Ceremonies (called Tsukimi in Japan) are held each year in autumn to celebrate the full moon and waxing moon in Japan.

This symbol shows Japanese pampas grass and dango (sweet dessert food) which are used in the ceremony, as well as the moon in the background.
title: Moon Viewing Ceremony

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Celebration symbols

bn:01264221n: Or, literally moon-viewing, also known as, refers to Japanese festivals honoring the autumn moon, a version of the Mid-Autumn Festival.

bn:00032381n: An image created by light falling on a light-sensitive surface or an electronic imager
Image created by light falling on a light-sensitive surface
An image captured by a camera or some other device and reproduced as a picture, usually on a sensitized surface and formed by the chemical action of light or of radiant energy.
A Surface application from Microsoft where users can browse and interact with photos and videos.
A representation of a person or scene in the form of a print or transparent slide; recorded by a camera on light-sensitive material
An image that has been captured electronically with a digital camera or scanner.
A photograph, photo or a picture is an image created by light falling on a light-sensitive surface, usually photographic film or an electronic medium such as a CCD or a CMOS chip.
A picture created by projecting an image onto a photosensitive surface such as a chemically treated plate or film, CCD receptor, etc.

bn:00055809n: Any substantially sized natural satellite of a planet.
The sole natural satellite of the Earth.
The natural satellite of the Earth
The first planet from Earth in the Ptolemaic geocentric model
The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite.

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the moon viewing ceremony emoji captures a serene nocturnal scene, showcasing a traditional Japanese setting bathed in the soft glow of a luminous moon. Apple's signature 3D rendering lends a subtle gloss and depth to the intricately designed pavilion and the celestial orb, creating a tranquil and elegant visual. This emoji evokes feelings of peace, reflection, and appreciation for nature's beauty, often used to convey a sense of calm or to mark special, quiet moments.
